module_restrictions: Any graduate (500-level or above) courses, including courses in the Medical School, Law School, School of Education, etc. Wharton courses are restricted to students on Wharton exchange.
visa_info: All exchange students who are not US citizens are required to obtain an F-1 or J-1 student visa for their exchange studies in the United States. Students must produce financial documentation showing that they have at least USD $14,323 in assets. Students are required to maintain approved health insurance coverage for the duration of their stay at U Penn.
accommodations_info: All exchange students are required to live in on-campus housing and enroll in a dining plan.
cost_of_living: Tuition fee charges are waived for exchange students. Exchange students who are not US citizens will be required to show adequate financial documentation to prove they can sustain themselves during the duration of their exchange.
university_description: The University of Pennsylvania, commonly referred to as U Penn or just Penn is a private Ivy League research university located in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania.
university_address: Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, USA
location_cost_of_living: Philadelphia is the fifth most expensive city in the United States, with a cost of living of 139, which is higher than the national average.
location_weather: Philadelphia has a humid subtropical climate with four distinct seasons and precipitation throughout the year.
location_description: Philadelphia is a historic and culturally rich city known for its art, history, and architecture. It was the first capital city of the United States.
location_crime: Philadelphia has a higher than average crime rate, particularly in property crimes, although violent crime has been decreasing in recent years.
location_transportation: Philadelphia has a public transportation system including buses, trains, and subways. There are also bike sharing and car rental options available.
location_halal: There are several halal food options available in Philadelphia.
location_vegetarian: There are several vegetarian food options available in Philadelphia.

faculties_accepted: Center for Education in Liberal Arts and Sciences
module_restrictions: Check http://www.osaka-u.ac.jp/en/international/inbound/exchange_program for any module restrictions and prerequisites
visa_info: Upon acceptance, Osaka U will apply for a Certificate of Eligibility on your behalf with the Japanese Ministry of Justice, and send it to you when issued. Students must obtain a “College Student” visa for the duration of their study in Japan. For more information on visa applications, please refer to https://iss-intl.osaka-u.ac.jp/supportoffice/eng/visa/
accommodations_info: Exchange students will be housed in the university housing, but placement in their preferred dormitory is not guaranteed, with fees ranging from JP¥20,000 – JP¥40,000 per month. Applications for housing will be accepted through the exchange program application webpage simultaneously with the confirmation of intent to enter the university after acceptance into the exchange program. For more information about accommodation, please refer to https://iss-intl.osaka-u.ac.jp/supportoffice/eng/housing/
university_description: Osaka University is a national research university located in Osaka, Japan. It was founded in 1724 as Kaitokudō (懐徳堂) and renamed to Osaka University in 1931. It is one of Japan's National Seven Universities and is generally considered one of Japan's most prestigious institutions of higher learning.
location_cost_of_living: The cost of living in Osaka is generally considered to be higher than the rest of Japan. However, it is still lower compared to other major cities in the world.
location_weather: The climate in Osaka is considered to be a humid subtropical climate with four distinct seasons. Summers are hot and humid, and winters are cool with occasional cold spells.
location_description: Osaka is the third-largest city in Japan and is located on the island of Honshu. It is known for being a commercial center, with many businesses concentrated in the city center.
location_crime: Osaka is generally considered to be a relatively safe city, with a low crime rate compared to other major cities in the world.
location_transportation: Osaka has an extensive public transportation network, including buses, subways, and trains. The city is also served by Osaka International Airport and Kansai International Airport.
location_halal: There are several halal food options available in Osaka, including restaurants and grocery stores.
location_vegetarian: There are vegetarian options available in Osaka, but they may be limited compared to other cities.

module_restrictions: Integrated Marketing Communications (Medill), Kellogg School of Management, Pritzker School of Law, Feinberg School of Medicine and Bienen School of Music
visa_info: Exchange students will apply for a J-1 Visa through Northwestern’s International Office after their acceptance.

accommodations_info.off-campus_housing: apartment or shared house in the Evanston or Chicago area

university_description: Northwestern University is a private research university in Evanston, Illinois. It was founded in 1851 and has a highly competitive admissions process with an acceptance rate of 8.4%.
location_cost_of_living: Evanston has a high cost of living compared to other cities in Illinois, with an overall cost of living index of 137.8 (as of 2021). Housing is the biggest factor in the cost of living index.
location_weather: Evanston has a humid continental climates with cold winters and warm summers. Temperature ranges from 20°F to 84°F with an average temperature of 52°F.
location_description: Evanston is a suburban city located in Cook County, Illinois, United States, situated north of downtown Chicago, and bordered by Chicago to the south, Skokie to the west, and Wilmette to the north. Northwestern University is located in Evanston.

module_restrictions: Individual departments may restrict access to specific courses.
visa_info: Students must complete all required forms and questionnaires, provide a copy of their valid passport and proof of sufficient funding.
accommodations_info: On-campus accommodation is available at Weaver Hall only. Spaces are limited and placement is not guaranteed.
cost_of_living: As a Partner School Exchange Student, you do not pay for the cost of your courses ('tuition') since this is waived under the exchange agreement between UF and your home university. This agreement ONLY covers tuition and DOES NOT cover fees for on-campus housing, library fines, labs, computer services, parking tickets, sports courses, leisure courses, etc. You are responsible for paying non-tuition fees in a timely manner.
university_description: The University of Florida is a public research university in Gainesville, Florida. It is a senior member of the State University System of Florida and traces its origins to 1853 and has operated continuously on its Gainesville campus since September 1906.
university_address: Gainesville, Florida, USA
location_description: Gainesville is a city in Alachua County, Florida, United States. It is the county seat and the largest city in the county.
location_transportation: Students can ride any Gainesville RTS bus free with their Gator 1 ID card.

university_name: The College of William and Mary
module_restrictions: Exchange students cannot take Law, Business Administration and Graduate-level courses.
visa_info: Exchange students will apply for a J-1 visa. To receive necessary paperwork to apply for a J-1 visa, students need to complete the iStart application. Students are strongly encouraged to complete the immigration paperwork at their earliest to avoid delays in visa issuance.

on-campus.additional_info: Each student must pay a refundable room damage deposit of USD $75.

on-campus.description: fraternity/sorority housing, language houses, Reves Hall (for students interested in International Studies)

meal_plan_options: varies depending on social class and living location
accommodations_info.early_arrivals: International on-campus students who arrive before designated arrival dates are responsible for finding their own housing accommodations. Temporary on-campus housing is not available.

additional_info: As a visiting exchange student, you will not be billed for W&M’s standard tuition; rather, you will continue to pay your home university’s tuition.

university_description: The College of William & Mary is a comprehensive university located in Williamsburg, Virginia. Founded in 1693, it is the second-oldest institution of higher education in the US after Harvard University. The university has a strong focus on undergraduate education and attracts students from all over the world.
location_description: Williamsburg is a city in the state of Virginia, known for its history and historic landmarks. It is a popular tourist destination and also attracts a large number of students due to the presence of the College of William & Mary. The city is located on the Virginia Peninsula and is part of the Hampton Roads metropolitan area.

visa_info: Exchange students who study for one semester only (less than 6 months) are not required to apply for a study permit. However, depending on your country of citizenship, you may have to apply for an eTA OR a visitor visa. For more information on visa applications, please refer to https://www.cic.gc.ca/english/visit/visas.asp.
university_description: The University of Toronto is a public research university in Toronto, Ontario, Canada. It was founded in 1827 as King's College and was granted university status in 1850.
location_cost_of_living: Toronto is a relatively expensive city to live in, with the average cost of living being around CAD 2,500-3,000 per month. Housing costs are a major contributor to these expenses.
location_weather: Toronto has warm summers and cold winters, with temperatures in the summer averaging around 25°C, and temperatures in the winter averaging around -10°C.
location_description: Toronto is the capital city of the province of Ontario and the largest city in Canada by population. It is a multicultural city known for its vibrant arts and culture scene, as well as its booming business and finance sectors.
location_crime: Toronto is generally considered a safe city with a relatively low crime rate compared to other major North American cities.
location_transportation: Toronto has a well-developed public transportation system that includes buses, subways and streetcars. The subway system in particular is convenient and can take you to most major destinations throughout the city.
location_halal: Toronto has a large Muslim population, and there are many halal food options available throughout the city.
location_vegetarian: Toronto has a large vegetarian and vegan population, and there are many restaurants and cafes that cater to this lifestyle.

module_restrictions: Only for NUS students who have completed at least 2 years of studies at NUS before the exchange starts at TUD. Courses belonging to Anglistics and English Literature are not open for exchange students.
visa_info: EU citizens and citizens from the following countries do not need a visa to enter Germany: Australia, Canada, Honduras, Iceland, Israel, Japan, Korea, Liechtenstein, Monaco, New Zealand, Norway, San Marino, Switzerland and the United States.

Students from all other countries must apply for a visa for study purposes via the German diplomatic representation in their home country. You must not under any circumstances travel to Germany on a tourist visa.

accommodations_info.University Accommodation: Accommodation is available in dormitories of Studierendenwerk Darmstadt. NUS students are guaranteed accommodation. The allocation of accommodation usually takes place approx. 1 – 1.5 months prior to the Kick-Off Meeting.
accommodations_info.Alternative Accommodation: In case rooms in dormitories are not available, the TUD department will assist the students in finding accommodation by sending them a detailed guidebook via e-mail.

university_description: Technical University of Darmstadt is a research university focused on engineering in Darmstadt, Germany.
location_description: Darmstadt is a city in the state of Hesse in Germany, located in the southern part of the Rhine-Main-Area (Frankfurt Metropolitan Region).

module_restrictions: Undergraduates and postgraduate Business and Law modules are not offered to NUS students.
visa_info: Students staying in Estonia for more than three months must apply for a long-stay (D) visa. Necessary supporting documents should be submitted to TalTech. Students are advised to apply for a visa as early as 2 months before the start of their exchange.

accommodations_info.University Accommodation: Limited accommodation is offered by the Academic Hostels in the university campus and in the city centre. Accommodation is not guaranteed and easier to get in semester 2. Students who fail to secure university accommodation can find private accommodation.
accommodations_info.Private Accommodation: Students who fail to secure university accommodation need to find private accommodation. Tips on how to find private housing are provided by Tallinn University of Technology.

cost_of_living: Monthly living expenses are estimated and can be found on Tallinn University of Technology's website.
university_description: Tallinn University of Technology, also known as TalTech, is Estonia's only technological university and one of the most important educational, research and development institutions in the country.
university_address: Ehitajate tee 5, 19086 Tallinn, Estonia
location_cost_of_living: Cost of living details beyond monthly estimates are not provided in the PDF.
location_weather: Tallinn's climate is humid, with warm summers and cold winters. Temperature averages are around 22°C (72°F) in summer and -2°C (28°F) in winter.
location_description: Tallinn is the capital and largest city of Estonia. It is a hub for tech start-ups and a popular tourist destination, known for its well-preserved medieval Old Town.
location_crime: No information about crime rate/situation in Tallinn is provided in the PDF.
location_transportation: Transportation options in Tallinn include buses, trams, trolleys, taxis, and bikes. The city also has a well-developed public transportation system.
location_halal: Halal food options in Tallinn are available at some restaurants and grocery stores, but a comprehensive list is not provided in the PDF.
location_vegetarian: Vegetarian food options in Tallinn are available at many restaurants and grocery stores, but a comprehensive list is not provided in the PDF.

visa_info: Exchange students who study for one semester only (less than 6 months) are not required to apply for a study permit. For more information on visa applications, please refer to https://www.cic.gc.ca/english/visit/visas.asp.
accommodations_info: The University of Alberta requires all incoming exchange students to enroll in the University of Alberta Health Insurance Plan (UAHIP). UAHIP is a mandatory health insurance that is similar to the Alberta Health Care Insurance Plan (AHCIP) provided by the Government of Alberta. It is recommended that you purchase a comprehensive travel insurance for the full duration of your stay abroad, including your personal travel within/outside Canada. Students can purchase additional health and/or travel insurance from their preferred agent.

module_restrictions: Must have taken modules at NUS within the specific subject field to be accepted to any of the departments at the University of Copenhagen.
visa_info: Information about immigration-related issues is available at: https://studies.ku.dk/exchange/living-in-denmark/residence-permit/. Additionally, you can contact the Denmark embassy in Singapore if you have a specific enquiry that the host university is unable to address.
accommodations_info: Information about student housing is available at: https://studies.ku.dk/exchange/living-in-denmark/finding-housing/
cost_of_living: Denmark’s currency is the krone. Information about the cost of living and estimated expenses in Denmark and Copenhagen is available at: https://studies.ku.dk/welcome/living-in-copenhagen/money-and-banking/
university_description: The University of Copenhagen is a public research university in Copenhagen, Denmark. Founded in 1479, it is the second-oldest university in Denmark and one of the oldest in Northern Europe.
location_cost_of_living: Copenhagen is known for being an expensive city, with high prices for food, housing, and transportation.
location_description: Copenhagen is the capital city of Denmark and is known for its beautiful architecture, vibrant culture, and commitment to sustainability.

faculties_accepted: Foreign Languages and Literature, Interpreting and Translation
module_restrictions: There are no specific language requirements for studying at the University of Bologna. Students without sufficient Italian proficiency are only allowed to read English-taught courses. The normal course load is 30 ECTS per semester.
visa_info: Non-EU citizen students going to UNIBO for more than 90 days will need to apply for a Visa for study purposes to enter Italy. Students should request the health insurance to be stamped by the Embassy/Consulate when applying for the visa such that it can be used for application of residency Permit, which is to be done upon arrival in Italy. When arriving in Italy, students must also apply for a Residence Permit. This is a compulsory procedure for all non-EU citizens wishing to stay in Italy for more than 90 days.
accommodations_info: Bologna welcomes a large number of students and finding accommodation can be difficult, especially in September at the beginning of the academic year. Start looking for accommodation well in advance. It is advisable to book an accommodation before arriving in Bologna.

module_restrictions: No limit on the number of modules per semester. Students are allowed to take courses offered by other departments/institutes, in addition to those of their own departments/institutes. They can also take courses of different program years and levels. Undergraduate students may take graduate courses, and vice versa.
visa_info: Students whose exchange period is one semester (or less than 180 days) will have to apply a Visitor Visa while students whose exchange period is more than 180 days will have to apply for a Resident Visa. Chinese, Hong Kong and Macau passport holders will need to apply for a Taiwan Entry Permit.
accommodations_info: On-campus accommodation is available to exchange students. After applications are accepted by NCKU, applicants will be prompted by email to sign up for on-campus accommodation online. Please note that space of the on-campus accommodation is not guaranteed, and students will be responsible for their own housing expenses. To have a quick review of NCKU on-campus dormitory designated to exchange students, please take a look at Ching-Yeh 3 Dorm, which offers double rooms to international students.
university_description: National Cheng Kung University (NCKU) was founded in 1931. It is a leading comprehensive university in Taiwan with more than sixty departments in nine colleges covering the fields of Bioscience and Biotechnology, Electrical Engineering and Computer Science, Engineering, Liberal Arts, Management, Medicine, Planning and Design, Sciences and Social Sciences. The University is committed to enhancing its reputation through abundant resources, strong alumni support, and cooperative ventures with the Tainan Science-based Industrial Park. NCKU has been selected as the Prominent Research University in Taiwan and voted Industry’s Most Favorable University.

module_restrictions: Course restrictions may be limited as pre-requisites may be required. Maximum of two Business courses may be taken per semester. CMU's School of Design, within their College of Fine Arts, is unable to welcome students at this time due to special constraints. This may be possible in the future.
visa_info: All students are advised to apply for the necessary visa immediately after they receive the official offer letter/email from their host university.
accommodations_info: University housing is available both on and off campus to all first-year students 17 years of age or older. First-year students under the age of 17 are asked to contact the Office of Housing Services. Transfer student housing is subject to availability and transfer students should contact the Office of Housing Services for more information. Housing facilities, located on the campus proper, are conveniently close to the academic buildings. The Oakland Community Apartments are located within a 5-10 minute walking distance to campus. The Oakland Community Apartments are serviced by the University's shuttle service on a regular basis.
university_description: Carnegie Mellon University is a private research university in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania. It was founded in 1900 by Andrew Carnegie as the Carnegie Technical Schools. It became Carnegie Mellon University in 1967. The university's seven colleges and independent schools offer over 80 degree programs.
university_address: Carnegie Mellon University, 5000 Forbes Ave, Pittsburgh, PA 15213, United States
location_cost_of_living: Pittsburgh's cost of living is 8.6% lower than the national average, according to Bestplaces.net.
location_weather: Pittsburgh has a four-season climate characterized by cold snowy winters, mild to warm rainy springs, hot and humid summers, and mild and pleasant autumns.
location_description: Pittsburgh is a city in the state of Pennsylvania in the United States. It is known as the Steel City and for its many bridges. It is also home to many museums and cultural sites, including the Andy Warhol Museum and the Carnegie Museum of Natural History.
location_crime: The crime rate in Pittsburgh is higher than the national average but has been decreasing in recent years.
location_transportation: Pittsburgh's public transit system, known as the Port Authority of Allegheny County, includes buses, light rail (known as the T), and inclines that climb steep hillsides.
location_halal: There are several halal food options in Pittsburgh including Salem's Halal Market & Grill, Pittsburgh Halal Food, and Nayaab Restaurant.
location_vegetarian: There are many vegetarian and vegan options in Pittsburgh including apteka, B52 Cafe, and Onion Maiden.

module_restrictions: Students must have completed at least 5 semesters of undergraduate studies before participating in exchange programme at MINES ParisTech.

visa_info: Long-Stay visas are necessary for stays exceeding 3 months.

accommodations_info: Accommodation offered to visiting students, if available, will be at either MINES ParisTech residences - Maison des Mines or Cité Internationale Universitaire de Paris (CIUP).

location_crime: Paris has a moderate crime rate, with pickpocketing being a common occurrence. However, violent crime is rare.
location_transportation: Paris has an extensive public transportation system, including an extensive metro and bus network.
location_halal: Paris has a wide selection of halal food options, with many restaurants and markets catering to Muslim dietary restrictions.
location_vegetarian: Paris has many vegetarian and vegan restaurants, as well as supermarkets and markets offering vegetarian options.

university_name: Korea Advanced Institute of Science and Technology (KAIST)
module_restrictions: Undergraduate students can apply for courses starting with course no. 1xx to 4xx. Master-level courses are not open to undergraduate students.
visa_info: Exchange students must apply for a D2 student visa before arrival in Korea.

accommodations_info.university_accommodation: KAIST will apply for on-campus accommodation for all exchange students based on their student exchange application. The assigned dormitories (Double or Triple occupancy) for exchange students are furnished with beds, closets, desks and chairs for each room. Share faculties include restrooms, showers, washing machines, clothes drier, and a lobby on each floor.

module_restrictions: Ensure that you meet the pre-requisites for the courses you are applying for.
visa_info: International students require a Non-Immigrant Education Visa (category ED) to study in Thailand.

accommodations_info.university_accommodation: Chulalongkorn University International House (CU iHouse) is a 26-storey, 846-unit, on campus residence for international students and lecturers. Rooms come fully furnished with air conditioner, modern conveniences, 24-hour security and safety systems. The residence is included in the university’s shuttle bus services. Kindly note that CU iHouse has limited availability. Please apply as early as possible or explore other alternative accommodation options.

university_description: Chulalongkorn University is a public and autonomous research university in Bangkok, Thailand. It is the oldest and one of the most prestigious universities in Thailand.

university_name: University of Tuebingen (Eberhard Karls Universität Tübingen)
faculties_accepted: Faculty of Economics and Social Sciences
module_restrictions: Courses from Faculty Medicine is not open to exchange students.
Availability in beginner’s German language courses (A1/A2 level) are limited and cannot be guaranteed.

Students who wish to study at Tuebingen Faculty of Science (= Natural Sciences) need to submit supporting documents such as a language certificate, Transcript of Records and Study Plan with a course list that can be sent to the Tuebingen Faculty of Science for approval.
visa_info: EU citizens and citizens from the following countries do not need a visa to enter Germany: Australia, Canada, Honduras, Iceland, Israel, Japan, Korea, Liechtenstein, Monaco, New Zealand, Norway, San Marino, Switzerland and the United States. However, after entering Germany, you will have to apply for a residence permit at the local 'Auslaenderbehörde' (Immigration Office) if you are staying for more than three months.

Students from all other countries must apply for a visa for study purposes via the German diplomatic representation in their home country. You must not under any circumstances travel to Germany on a tourist visa.
accommodations_info: Accommodation is administered by the Studierendenwerk (Student Services Organization), which is not affiliated with the University.

You could possibly get the university accommodation if you submit an application before the deadline which will be mentioned in Tuebingen’s acceptance email. For an overview of the dormitories, please see: https://en.my-stuwe.de/housing/halls-of-residence-tuebingen/
All rooms for exchange students are fully furnished single rooms with shared kitchen and usually shared bathrooms.

Students who have contract that ends in August or September are expected to pay for the rental until August or September. There will be no refund of the rental if you leave the student accommodation earlier.

Deposit for the student accommodation will only be returned to you after you have fulfilled the conditions for the full refund of deposit. It takes approximately four months for the rental deposit (if applicable) to be returned to you.

faculties_accepted: All faculties except Business, Design & Environment, Law

university_name: Norwegian University of Science and Technology (NTNU)
module_restrictions: Most faculties will consider undergraduate exchange students except for Architecture, Marine Technology and Electric Power Engineering. Only courses at a master’s level (year 4 and 5) are offered in English for Architecture students, while pre-requisites apply to some courses.
visa_info: Students need to apply for the necessary visa immediately after receiving the official offer letter/email from their host university, with some visa application processes taking up to 2 months. Students staying in Norway for more than three months have to apply for a student residence permit, and register with the Trondheim Police, Foreign Section within 7 days after arrival.
accommodations_info: Exchange students from non-EU/non-EEA countries who applied within the deadline are guaranteed housing, and it is recommended that students go in Semester 2 where more housing is available.
cost_of_living: Estimated monthly living expenses include NOK 3,000-6,000 for accommodation, NOK 500 for transportation, NOK 3,000 for food, and NOK 6,500 for others (books, entertainment etc.), with a monthly estimate of NOK 13,000-15,500.
university_description: The Norwegian University of Science and Technology (NTNU) is a public research university in Norway which offers study opportunities for international students
location_cost_of_living: Norway is known for being one of the most expensive countries in the world to live in, with high costs for food, accommodation, and transportation.
location_weather: Norway has a temperate maritime climate, with mild winters and cool summers influenced by its coastal location and warm Gulf Stream.
location_description: Norway is a Scandinavian country known for its natural beauty of fjords, mountains, and northern lights, as well as for its strong welfare state and high living standards.
location_crime: Norway has a relatively low crime rate and is considered to be a safe country to study and live in.
location_transportation: Norway has an extensive public transportation system of buses, trains, and ferries, with many cities and towns easily accessible by bike or walking.
location_halal: Halal food options are available in some areas of Norway, particularly in bigger cities like Oslo, but may be limited in other regions.
location_vegetarian: Norway has a variety of vegetarian food options available in most restaurants, cafes, and supermarkets.

visa_info: Exchange students who study for one semester only (less than 6 months) are not required to apply for a study permit. However, depending on your country of citizenship, you may have to apply for an eTA OR a visitor visa. For more information on visa applications, please refer to https://www.cic.gc.ca/english/visit/visas.asp.
accommodations_info: It is recommended that you purchase a comprehensive travel insurance for the full duration of your stay abroad, including your personal travel within/outside Canada. Please review the insurance coverages to ensure that they meet your needs.

visa_info: Exchange students who study for one semester only (less than 6 months) are not required to apply for a study permit. However, depending on your country of citizenship, you may have to apply for an eTA OR a visitor visa. For more information on visa applications, please refer to https://www.cic.gc.ca/english/visit/visas.asp.
university_description: McGill University is a public research university in Montreal, Canada. It was founded in 1821 and is one of the oldest universities in Canada.
location_cost_of_living: Montreal is generally considered to be an affordable city for students, with a lower cost of living compared to other major cities in Canada and the US.
location_weather: Montreal has a cold and snowy winter season, with temperatures ranging between -13°C to -5°C. Summers are mild, ranging from 10°C to 27°C.
location_description: Montreal is the second-largest city in Canada and is known for its cultural diversity, historic architecture, and vibrant nightlife. The city is bilingual, with French and English being the official languages.
location_transportation: Montreal has an extensive public transportation system, including a metro system, buses, and trains. Students can purchase a monthly transit pass for unlimited travel on public transportation.
location_halal: Montreal has a significant Muslim population and halal food options are available throughout the city.
location_vegetarian: Vegetarian food options are widely available in Montreal, with many restaurants offering vegetarian and vegan options on their menus.

visa_info: Exchange students must apply to New Zealand Immigration for a student visa and obtain the visa before entering New Zealand. Please note that it is NOT possible for exchange students to travel to New Zealand on a visitor's visa and apply for a student permit upon arrival in New Zealand, even if you are a citizen of a country with which New Zealand has a visa waiver agreement. It is imperative that all exchange students get their student visa BEFORE travelling to New Zealand, as you may be refused a student permit if you apply from within New Zealand. Students are advised to apply for the necessary visa immediately after they received the official offer letter/email from their host university. This is to ensure that you can obtain your visa in time before the start of your exchange term. Your exchange at the host university depends on the clearance by the immigration of the host country. For more information on visa applications, please refer to https://www.immigration.govt.nz/new-zealand-visas/options/study
accommodations_info: Exchange students are required to purchase a compulsory medical and travel insurance when studying in New Zealand. The University of Auckland’s  preferred insurance policy for International students is Studentsafe-University. The estimated cost is NZ$350 per semester. The Studentsafe insurance fee will be charged to students account automatically upon enrolment. It is recommended that you purchase a comprehensive travel insurance for the full duration of your stay abroad, including your personal travel within/outside Australia. Please review the insurance coverages to ensure that they meet your needs. Students can purchase additional health and/or travel insurance from their preferred agent.
university_description: The University of Auckland is the largest university in New Zealand, located in the country's largest city, Auckland. It is the highest-ranked university in the country, and was ranked 81st worldwide in the 2019/20 QS World University Rankings. It was established in 1883 as a constituent college of the University of New Zealand.
location_cost_of_living: Auckland is considered more expensive than most other cities in New Zealand. The cost of living in Auckland varies depending on the student's lifestyle, but on average, students can expect to spend around NZD 15,000 - NZD 20,000 per year on accommodation, food, transportation, and other living expenses.
location_weather: Auckland has a temperate, maritime climate, with warm, humid summers and mild, damp winters. The average temperature in summer (December/January/February) is around 24°C (75°F), while average winter (June/July/August) temperatures hover around 14°C (57°F).
location_description: Auckland is the largest city in New Zealand and is located on the North Island. It is a vibrant and multicultural city that offers a range of cultural and outdoor activities. The city is known for its harbor, beaches, and parks, as well as its thriving arts and culture scene.
location_crime: Auckland is generally considered a safe city, but like any urban area, it is important to remain aware of your surroundings and take basic precautions to avoid becoming a victim of crime.
location_transportation: Auckland has an extensive public transportation system that includes buses, trains, and ferries. The Auckland Transport website provides information on routes, schedules, and fares.
location_halal: There are a number of halal food options available in Auckland, particularly in areas with a high Muslim population like the suburb of Mt Roskill.
location_vegetarian: Vegetarian food is readily available in Auckland, with many restaurants and cafes offering vegetarian and vegan options.

module_restrictions: Practical courses such as Medicine, Pharmacy and Dental Sciences are not open to exchange students. Courses offered by Kyushu U Business School and Law School are not open to JTW students.
visa_info: Exchange students must obtain a “College Student” visa for the duration of their study in Japan. Upon acceptance, Kyushu U will apply for a Certificate of Eligibility on your behalf with the Japanese Ministry of Justice, and send it to you when issued.
accommodations_info: Exchange students will be housed at the residence halls (Dormitory 1, Dormitory 2, or Kyosokan (Harmony House).
university_description: Kyushu University is a public research university in Fukuoka, Japan. It is one of Japan's National Seven Universities and is also a member of the Kyushu-Ryukyu University Association.
location_description: Fukuoka is the capital city of Fukuoka Prefecture, situated on the northern shore of the Japanese island of Kyushu. It is an important economic hub of the island, and is home to various cultural institutions and universities.

faculties_accepted: Faculty of Science (departments of Biology/Biochemistry, Chemistry, Computer Science, Mathematical Sciences, Natural Sciences, Physics)
Faculty of Engineering & Design (departments of Chemical Engineering, Civil Engineering, Electrical and Electronics Engineering)
Faculty of Humanities & Social Sciences (departments of Economics, Education, Health, Politics, Language and International Studies, Psychology, Social and Policy Sciences)
module_restrictions: Postgraduate modules are not open to undergraduate exchange students
visa_info: Standard Visitor Visa for semester exchange; Student Visa for full-year exchange
accommodations_info: Exchange students can choose between two city centre locations (Pulteney Court or Thornbank Gardens) and can refer to the provided links for more information on housing and accommodation prices.

cost_of_living.transport: £200 per semester (bus from city centre to University)

university_description: The University of Bath is a public university located in Bath, United Kingdom. Known for its excellence in science, engineering, humanities, social sciences, and management, the University of Bath aims to deliver world-class research and teaching that is responsive to the demands of the economy and society.
university_address: University of Bath, Claverton Down, Bath BA2 7AY, United Kingdom
location_cost_of_living: Bath is a relatively expensive city to live in compared to other cities in the UK. The cost of living is high due to the city's relatively high standard of living. Accommodation, food, transportation, and entertainment expenses are the highest cost areas.
location_weather: Bath has a temperate climate, with mild winters and cool summers. Rainfall is fairly evenly distributed throughout the year with occasional snowfall in the winter. The average temperature ranges from 1.5°C in winter to about 20°C in summer.
location_description: Bath is a city located in the southwest of England and is known for its Roman-built baths, Georgian architecture, and natural hot springs. It is a UNESCO World Heritage site and attracts many tourists throughout the year. The city has a population of around 90,000 people and has a vibrant cultural scene.
location_crime: Bath is considered a relatively safe city compared to other cities in the UK. However, like any city, it is important to take precautions to protect yourself and your belongings from potential theft or crime.
location_transportation: Bath has a public transportation system consisting of buses and trains. The University of Bath is located about 3 miles from the city centre, which can be reached by a regular bus service. Buses and trains also connect Bath to other major cities in the UK.
location_halal: There are halal food options available in Bath, particularly in the city centre where there are a number of halal restaurants and stores.
location_vegetarian: Vegetarian food options are abundant in Bath, with many vegetarian and vegan restaurants, cafes, and stores available.

faculties_accepted: College of Health & Agricultural Science (excluding Medicine, Nursing, and Veterinary Medicine)
module_restrictions: Graduate modules are not open to undergraduate exchange students. Please note that module restrictions may apply in the areas of Health & Agriculture Sciences, Education, Psychology, Business, Law, English Literature, and History.

visa_info.requirements: All students are advised to apply for the necessary visa immediately after they receive the official offer letter/email from their host university. The visa application process could take up to 2 months to process. Your exchange at the host university depends on clearance by the immigration of the host country.
visa_info.registration_requirements: All students who do NOT hold an EU passport must register with the Irish Naturalisation and Immigration Service (INIS) after arrival in Ireland. Further information on the requirements to register can be found on the INIS website: https://www.irishimmigration.ie/coming-to-study-in-ireland/before-and-after-you-arrive/what-do-i-need-to-do-after-arriving/

on_campus.description: UCD has on-campus accommodation for over 2,500 students in both halls of residence and three, four, five and six-bedroom self-catering apartments. These are spread across five locations, with 300 places located on the nearby Blackrock Campus. However, places are limited and on-campus accommodation is not guaranteed.
on_campus.rental_cost: The on-campus accommodation rental cost must be paid in full at the start of each semester.

off_campus.description: For more information on off-campus housing, please visit https://www.ucd.ie/global/study-at-ucd/accommodation/offcampusaccommodation/. Alternatively, students can arrive 2-3 weeks before term begins in order to search for suitable accommodation. There is enormous demand for accommodation in the areas of Dublin surrounding UCD. The search starts in August and increases throughout September/October. Students should note that it is always advisable to view private accommodation in advance and read the fine print in order to ascertain that it suits your requirements.

cost_of_living: Information on cost of living can be found at https://www.ucd.ie/global/study-at-ucd/scholarshipsfinances/livingcosts/.

module_restrictions: Some courses with capacity limit do not accept exchange students. For pre-requisite required courses, students must have taken courses considered equivalent to the pre-requisite. Exchange students are normally allowed to take courses at undergraduate level only (course level: B1-B4) unless approved otherwise.
visa_info: Consular/Visa Regulation Details and procedures can be found at http://www.immd.gov.hk and http://www.cityu.edu.hk/geo. Students are encouraged to apply for student visa to Hong Kong via CityU. CityU may act as the local sponsor of exchange students who are accepted for admission and meet Hong Kong visa application requirements. Completed application form and other necessary documents should be sent to the Global Services Office, Rm 3210, 3/F, Cheng Yick-chi Building, City University of Hong Kong, Tat Chee Avenue, Kowloon, Hong Kong SAR at least 6-8 weeks before the semester starts. An Administrative Fee for Student Visa/Entry Permit Application at HK$600 will be charged. The fee is non-refundable and non-transferable. As the student visa/entry permit application processing may take 8 weeks or even longer, students should file their application by the following deadline: Semester A (September Intake): 1st June / Semester B (January Intake): 1st November *Students are encouraged to file their student visa/entry permit application first even if they have not yet received the letter of acceptance.

accommodations_info.info: Exchange students may apply for accommodation at Student Residence but it is NOT guaranteed due to limited spaces. Allocation of accommodation will be made by a random ballot. Students should file their accommodation application before the deadline.

Exchange students may choose to stay in commercially operated accommodation recommended by CityU, or rent your own flat on the market. Students will be invited to join a Facebook group with guidance on searching off-campus housing in Hong Kong and to find suitable flatmates to share a flat in the city. The rental for off-campus accommodations varies, depending on the size, location, age of the building, etc.

university_description: City University of Hong Kong offers professional education that prepares its students for the challenges and exciting opportunities opening up in Hong Kong, the Asia-Pacific region and throughout the world in business, science and engineering, energy and environment, law, creative media and social sciences. Through its extensive links with relevant industries, CityU provides real-life opportunities for students to work with and learn from professionals in the workplace.

location_description: Seoul is the capital and largest city of South Korea. It has a rich history and culture, and is known for its technology and fashion industries.
location_transportation: Seoul has an extensive public transportation system, including buses, subways, and trains.

accommodations_info: On-campus housing is available through the Division of University Housing. The University residence halls are a short walk or short ride on the campus circular bus route (Route 80) to class. All University residence hall students have access to University residence hall dining rooms.
Off-campus housing is available, but it is up to the student to find and arrange appropriate accommodations.

university_description: The University of Wisconsin-Madison is one of the oldest and most prestigious public universities in the United States. It is a flagship institution of the University of Wisconsin System and offers a wide range of undergraduate and graduate programs.
university_address: University of Wisconsin-Madison, 500 Lincoln Dr, Madison, WI 53706, USA
location_cost_of_living: Madison, Wisconsin is an affordable city to live in, with a low cost of living compared to other major cities in the US.
location_weather: Madison, Wisconsin has a humid continental climate, with warm summers and cold winters. Average temperatures range from the low 20s °F (-6 to -4 °C) in January to the high 70s °F (24 to 26 °C) in July.
location_description: Madison, Wisconsin is the capital of Wisconsin and home to the University of Wisconsin-Madison. It is a vibrant city with a diverse population, a thriving arts scene, and many cultural and recreational opportunities.
location_crime: Madison, Wisconsin has a low crime rate compared to other cities of similar size in the US. The city has a well-funded and highly-regarded police force that is dedicated to keeping the city safe.
location_transportation: Madison, Wisconsin has a public transportation system that includes buses and a light rail system. The city is also bike-friendly, with many bike lanes and trails.
location_halal: Halal food options are available in Madison, Wisconsin.
location_vegetarian: Vegetarian food options are available in Madison, Wisconsin.

visa_info: All non-local students are required to obtain a student visa to study in HKSAR. Students must complete online visa application by the visa application deadline and send hard copies of application documents to designated visa office after receiving instructions. It will take at least 10 weeks to process student’s visa application and the visa application fee is non-refundable.
accommodations_info: On-campus accommodation for exchange students is on first-come-first-served basis and NOT guaranteed. Most of the rooms are double room. Only St. John’s College, Ricci Hall and HKU Residential Colleges provide very limited single rooms. Some halls have compulsory meal plans, others do not. Students may apply for accommodation before receiving the Notice of Admission.
university_description: The University of Hong Kong (HKU), founded in 1911, is the oldest tertiary institution in Hong Kong and one of the best comprehensive universities in Asia. The campus is situated on the north-western slopes of Hong Kong Island between 50 to 150 metres above sea level and overlooks the wide sweep of Victoria Harbour. Since its establishment in 1911, it has undertaken the mission of providing a holistic education, developing the intellectual and personal strengths of its students.
location_description: Hong Kong is a special administrative region on the eastern side of the Pearl River estuary in southern China. With a population of over seven million of people and a total land area of 1,106 km², Hong Kong is one of the most densely populated regions in the world. Hong Kong is known for its impressive skyline and deep natural harbor. The city has lots of architectural style influenced by the many different cultures that have come through its doors.

module_restrictions: Exchange students can choose CCs in the Core Programme and/or elective major specialties provided that the courses taken are effectively taught (and taken) during the appropriate semester and that the choice is compatible with the overall university course schedules.
visa_info: Long-Stay visas are necessary for stays exceeding 3 months. Upon arrival in France, students are required to register with the French Immigration and Integration Office (OFII) for a residence permit. All students who wish to study in France must follow the Campus France procedure on Etudes en France online platform before applying for a visa.

accommodations_info.university_accommodation: There are two types of accommodation available: student residences managed by the French government (CROUS) and private residences. Student residences are generally situated at a walking distance from the campus facilities and academic departments. Students who wish to stay in the student residence must contact the international office by sending an email to sadia.baiche@utc.fr.

university_description: Université de Technologie Compiègne (UTC) is located in Compiègne, northern France, and is a leading engineering school. It offers a flexible course system whereby the students gain and accumulate Credit Course (CCs) points, over a two-semester period.
location_cost_of_living: Compiègne is an affordable place to live. The city is small, and the cost of living is generally lower when compared to Paris or other large French cities.
location_description: Compiègne is a charming city rich in history and culture. It is known for its beautiful forest and the Château de Compiègne, the former summer residence of French kings.
location_transportation: Public transportation options in Compiègne include buses and trains. The city has a train station with regular connections to Paris and other major cities in France.

location_cost_of_living: The cost of living in Brisbane, where the University is located, is generally considered high, with accommodation being a major expense. Students should be prepared to budget accordingly.
location_description: Brisbane is a large city and capital of Queensland, Australia. It is known for its beautiful outdoor spaces, art, and music. With a vibrant nightlife and cultural scene, Brisbane is a great place to live and study.

university_description: The University of Southern California (USC) is a private research university in Los Angeles, California. USC's academic programs range from business, law, engineering, and medicine, to the humanities and the social sciences. It is a globally recognized university, with around 20,000 students from over 150 countries.
university_address: Los Angeles, California, USA
location_cost_of_living: Los Angeles is known to be an expensive city in the United States to live in. Housing is particularly expensive with high rent and utility costs.
location_weather: Los Angeles generally has a Mediterranean climate, with warm to hot summers and mild winters. January is the coldest month, and August is the warmest month. The city experiences plenty of sunshine throughout the year.
location_description: Los Angeles is a sprawling city, known for its association with the entertainment industry, including Hollywood, Universal Studios, and Paramount Pictures. The city has a diverse population and is home to many iconic landmarks such as Beverly Hills, Santa Monica Pier, and the Hollywood Walk of Fame.
location_crime: Los Angeles has a higher crime rate than the average US city. However, crime rates vary depending on the neighborhood and time of day, and certain areas are considerably safer than others.
location_transportation: Los Angeles has a public transportation system, including buses and trains, but private transportation in the form of cars or taxis is the most common way of getting around the city.
location_halal: Los Angeles is known for its diverse food options, including halal food options. Halal food availability should not be an issue for Muslim students.
location_vegetarian: Similarly, vegetarian food options are abundant in Los Angeles and should not be difficult to find.

location_weather: The city has a humid continental climate with long cold winters and short but moderately warm summers.
location_description: Calgary is a cosmopolitan city that blends Western fun and country roots in a mix of old and new. The city is known for hosting the annually held Calgary Stampede, a rodeo that draws visitors from all over the world.
location_crime: Calgary is generally a safe city with a lower crime rate compared to other Canadian cities like Vancouver and Toronto.

location_halal: There is a wide variety of halal food options available in Calgary.

visa_info: For less than 6 months, you can request entry to the UK as a Standard Visitor when you arrive. For a full-year exchange in Manchester, you need a Student Visa. Please check the latest UK visa requirements before leaving.

accommodations_info.university_accommodation: Study Abroad/Exchange students who go to Manchester for a year as part of their degree are guaranteed a room in University-owned accommodation for their time in Manchester. Study Abroad/Exchange students on single semester exchange at Manchester are not guaranteed accommodation but are almost always allocated University accommodation under normal circumstances.
accommodations_info.private_accommodation: Private accommodation can be more expensive than University accommodation. However, some very good deals can still be found in Manchester. If you choose to stay in private accommodation, Manchester has its own service, Manchester Student Homes, based on campus to help and advise students on finding private accommodation.

cost_of_living.estimated_monthly_expenses: Detailed breakdown of living costs is available at http://www.manchester.ac.uk/study/international/finance/living-costs/

university_description: The University of Manchester is a public research university in Manchester, England, formed in 2004 by the merger of the University of Manchester Institute of Science and Technology and the Victoria University of Manchester.

location_transportation: Paris has an extensive public transportation system consisting of metro, buses, trams, and regional trains, making it easy to get around the city and nearby areas.

location_vegetarian: Paris has a growing number of vegetarian and vegan options, with many restaurants and cafes offering vegetarian and vegan menu items.

university_description: The National Taiwan University (NTU) was established in 1945 with five colleges – College of Liberal Arts and Law, College of Medicine, College of Science, College of Agriculture and College of Engineering. Today, NTU is a comprehensive university with eleven colleges offering a wide range of up-to-date disciplines and numerous research centres.

faculties_accepted: Institute for Liberal Arts and Sciences
module_restrictions: Graduate level courses are not available to undergraduate students
Exchange students can take courses which start and end within the period of their exchange at Kyoto U
Courses of Faculty of Medicine are not open to exchange students

Some courses offered by the Faculties, including almost all courses offered by Faculty of Letters start in April and end in March. Such courses can be taken only by students who stay at Kyoto U for one full year exchange.
visa_info: Kyoto U will apply for a Certificate of Eligibility on your behalf with the Japanese Ministry of Justice, and send it to you when issued. The certificate is required for you to apply for a study visa. Exchange students must obtain a “College Student” visa for the duration of their study in Japan.
accommodations_info: Kyoto U has one on-campus and four off-campus International Houses, and other dormitories available to international students. Students do not have to apply for accommodation by themselves but will be required to send back the pre-registration form enclosed in the acceptance package. Students can choose to stay in one of the following accommodations - Yoshida International House (located on campus), Shugakuin International House and Misasagi International House. Other accommodation options include Mizuki-Dormitory, Satuski-Domitory and Dormitory Hyakumanben.
university_description: Kyoto University is a national university in Kyoto, Japan. It is the second oldest Japanese university, one of the highest ranked universities in Asia and one of Japan's National Seven Universities.
location_cost_of_living: Kyoto has a reputation for being expensive due to its rich cultural heritage and many attractions. However, its cost of living is still relatively affordable compared to other major Japanese cities like Tokyo and Osaka.
location_weather: Kyoto has a humid subtropical climate with hot, humid summers and cool winters.
location_description: Kyoto is a city located in the central part of the island of Honshu, Japan. It has a population close to 1.5 million people and is famous for its numerous classical Buddhist temples, gardens, imperial palaces, Shinto shrines and traditional wooden houses.

module_restrictions: Most Bachelor level courses are taught in Swedish. Only students in 3rd year and above are able to participate in SEP to Chalmers University of Technology. Architecture students must be in 4th year to participate in exchange to Chalmers. NUS students cannot attend courses from Chalmers Department of Technology Management and Economics which includes Industrial Engineering and Business courses.
visa_info: Students from non EU/EEA countries need to apply for a residence permit for studies before entering Sweden. Further information and application forms regarding residence permit may be obtained from the Swedish Embassy or Consulate in the home country of the student, or from Migrationsverket (the Migration Board). Students are strongly advised to apply as soon as they receive their Letter of Acceptance.
accommodations_info: Chalmers cannot guarantee accommodation for exchange students but will try best to provide accommodation to incoming exchange students. Incoming exchange students from NUS receive an email from Chalmers with instruction on how to apply for housing in Gothenburg. Chalmers has agreements with the housing agencies SGS Studentbostäder and Chalmers studentbostäder.
university_description: Chalmers University of Technology is a Swedish university located in Gothenburg, Sweden. It was founded in 1829 and has a focus on research-based education.
university_address: Chalmers University of Technology, SE-412 96 Gothenburg, Sweden
location_cost_of_living: Gothenburg is known to be more expensive than other Swedish cities. As of 2021, the estimated monthly living expenses range from SEK10,180 – SEK 13,089.
location_weather: Gothenburg has a temperate oceanic climate, with cool summers and mild winters. The weather can be unpredictable and rainy, so it's important to pack accordingly.
location_description: Gothenburg is the second-largest city in Sweden and is known for its vibrant cultural scene, including music and art festivals. It's also situated on the west coast of Sweden, which allows for easy access to the archipelago and the sea.
location_crime: Gothenburg has a moderate crime rate, with pickpocketing being the most common crime for tourists. It's important to be aware of your surroundings and keep valuable belongings secure.
location_transportation: Gothenburg has an extensive public transportation system, including buses, trams, and ferries. The city also has a bike-sharing program, which is a popular means of transportation for both locals and tourists.
location_halal: Halal food options are available in Gothenburg, with several halal restaurants and grocery stores throughout the city.
location_vegetarian: Vegetarian food options are widely available in Gothenburg, with many restaurants offering vegetarian and vegan options on their menus.

accommodations_info: KIT cannot guarantee the availability of accommodation but will assist all exchange students settling down in Karlsruhe. Most students in Karlsruhe live in dormitories or share a flat. Students will be informed about housing possibilities within 8 weeks of the application deadline. university_description: Karlsruhe Institute of Technology (KIT) is a public research university and one of the largest research and educational institutions in Germany. It was established in 2009 following the merger of the University of Karlsruhe and the Karlsruhe Research Center.

module_restrictions: Physical education courses, foreign language courses, and courses in School of Medicine are not open to exchange students. KIP students who wish to take Japanese language courses will go through a self-graded test and will be placed in the level determined by his/her score for the test. In addition, students who wish to take advanced subjects must take the JLP placement test to be placed into advanced or higher study levels. All JLP students are required to take the Japanese language program placement test at the beginning of each semester.
visa_info: Upon acceptance, Keio will apply for a Certificate of Eligibility on your behalf with the Japanese Ministry of Justice, and send it to you when issued. The certificate is required for you to apply for a study visa. Exchange students must obtain a “College Student” visa for the duration of their study in Japan. Please visit the Japan Embassy website for the required supporting documents for your visa application. All students are advised to apply for the necessary visa immediately after they received the official offer letter/email from their host university. This is to ensure that you can obtain your visa in time before the start of your exchange term. Your exchange at the host university depends on the clearance by the immigration of the host country.
accommodations_info: Keio housing (accommodations subsidized by Keio) is GUARANTEED for exchange students if they apply for housing on time. The rent charged to students varies from ¥55,000 to ¥79,100. Students will also be charged a one-time, additional maintenance fee of ¥20,000 for their first month’s rent. Deposits and key money are not required. Housing information and application form will be sent to students together with the acceptance letter. For more information about accommodation, please refer to http://www.ic.keio.ac.jp/en/study/exchange/housing.html and http://www.ic.keio.ac.jp/en/life/housing/ryu_boshu.html and https://www.keio.ac.jp/en/student-life/housing.html

accommodations_info.University Accommodation: Exchange student housing choices: University housing in apartments: the Bear Creek apartments can be a very good choice for exchange students. Bear Creek is run by the university and offers many social activities in addition to housing. Accommodation is in self-catering, ensuite apartments for students who are beyond their first year of university study. You apply as an individual and will be matched with roommates(s).  Although the normal contract is for 9 or 12 months, if you will only be here for a semester, Bear Creek will allow a contract for the semester only if space allows. You apply online. **Note that Bear Creek is not an option for exchange students for the 2021-2022 Academic Year.
accommodations_info.Off campus housing: we strongly recommend that students who wish to live off campus, arrive to find housing 1 - 2 weeks earlier than the date on the immigration document.

module_restrictions: Exchange students are not allowed to take courses at Nursing, Pharmacy, Law, Social Work, Medicine and education. Students will not be able to take any more than 6 modules (18 credits) while on exchange at U Conn.
visa_info: Prospective international exchange students must request a Form DS-2019, which they will need to apply for a J-1 Exchange Visitor Visa and later on to enter and stay in the U.S. in legal J-1 status. Total visa costs, including a required SEVIS fee, can total a minimum of 340 USD. Citizens of some countries may be subject to extra visa reciprocity fees.
accommodations_info: We recommend that all exchange students live on campus in residence halls. On-campus living is an important part of American university life, and by living on campus, you become an active member of the UConn community and have access to all the social, recreational, and cultural events that take place. All dorm rooms are equipped with a bed, a mattress, a desk and chair, and a closet. In small units, doubles are 154 sq. ft. (11×14). Elsewhere, double rooms range in size up to 180 sq. ft. Most undergraduate dormitory rooms share bathroom facilities with other residents on the floor. Refrigerators, microwaves and televisions are not provided in dorm rooms.
cost_of_living: Estimated monthly living expenses can be found on this link: http://financialaid.uconn.edu/cost/.

visa_info: Students who are on exchange in UK for less than six months are not entitled to subsidised NHS treatment. All registered NUS students are covered under the group personal accident and medical insurance as well as the student travel insurance. For more information on the insurance coverage, please refer to https://myportal.nus.edu.sg/studentportal/student-insurance/all/. If the insurance coverage is not enough, students are advised to purchase additional health and/or travel insurance from their preferred agent. Students need a Student Visa for a full-year exchange in Leeds.

university_description: University College Cork (UCC) was established in 1845 and is one of the oldest universities in Ireland. It is a leading research-intensive university that offers a wide range of undergraduate and postgraduate programmes across various faculties. UCC is internationally recognized for its research in areas such as science, engineering, food science, and health sciences. The university is known for its international outlook and has established partnerships with institutions around the world.
university_address: University College Cork, College Road, Cork, T12 YN60, Ireland
location_cost_of_living: Cork is generally considered to be an expensive city for students, with cost of living higher than the national average in Ireland. However, this can vary depending on your lifestyle and accommodation options. In general, accommodation can be a major expense for students in Cork.
location_weather: Cork experiences a temperate oceanic climate, with mild winters and cool summers. Temperatures in winter typically range from 4-10 °C (39-50 °F), while temperatures in summer range from 15-20 °C (59-68 °F). Cork also receives a moderate amount of rain throughout the year, with the wettest months being October and November.
location_description: Cork is a city located on the south coast of Ireland. It is the second largest city in the Republic of Ireland after Dublin, and is known for its rich history, vibrant culture, and beautiful natural scenery. Cork has a thriving arts and music scene, and is home to many historic landmarks and museums. The city is also located close to several natural attractions, including beaches, parks, and hiking trails.
location_crime: Cork is generally a safe city, but it is still important to take precautions and stay aware of your surroundings. Petty theft and pickpocketing can occur in busy tourist areas, so it is advisable to keep valuables secure and avoid carrying large amounts of cash. The Irish police force, known as the Garda Síochána, are responsible for maintaining law and order in Cork and throughout the country.
location_transportation: Cork has a good public transportation system that includes buses, trains, and taxis. The bus network is operated by Bus Éireann, and provides service to most areas of the city and surrounding countryside. The train network is operated by Iarnród Éireann, and connects Cork with other major cities in Ireland. There are also several taxi companies operating in Cork, and Uber is available in the city.
location_halal: There are several halal food options available in Cork, including restaurants and grocery stores. Some popular halal restaurants in Cork include Sultan Restaurant, Zaytoon, and Spicy Nights. There are also several halal meat shops in the city, including Cork Halal Meat and Kaheen's Halal Butchers.
location_vegetarian: Cork has a variety of vegetarian food options available, including restaurants, cafes, and grocery stores. Some popular vegetarian restaurants in Cork include Café Paradiso, Quay Co-op, and The Rocket Man. Most restaurants in Cork also offer vegetarian options on their menus.

It's famed for its Victorian and art nouveau architecture, a rich legacy of the city's 18th–20th-century prosperity due to trade and shipbuilding. Today it's a national cultural hub, home to institutions including the Scottish Opera, Scottish Ballet and National Theatre of Scotland, acclaimed museums and a thriving music scene.

visa_info: Exchange students in China are required to apply for student visa (X2 visa for those intending to study in China for a period of no more than 180 days and X1 visa for those intending to study in China for a period of more than 180 days). You will receive the admission letter and visa application form (JW202) once you are accepted by the host university for the student exchange programme. Exchange students are required to apply for the student visa in person at the China Visa Application Service Centre in Singapore with the relevant documents before the start of the academic semester.
accommodations_info: Both Xuhui campus and Minhang campus provide on-campus dormitories. Students are required to submit reservation through online system. Due to the limited number of dormitories, on-campus accommodation is not guaranteed. Exchange students will need to arrange for off-campus accommodation if application for on-campus accommodation is unsuccessful. Students without a successful online reservation for on-campus accommodation is required to arrange for off-campus accommodation before arrival. Students may refer to the Information on the Off-Campus Accommodation.
cost_of_living: The necessary expenses for the duration of the SEP range from S$5,000 to S$15,000 per semester, subject to the country and local conditions at the overseas Partner University during the period of exchange. In the neighborhood of Xuhui campus, the average rent for one-room lodging is 3,000 yuan per month. While around Minhang campus, the average rent will be around 2,000 yuan per month.

module_restrictions: Online courses: ASU offers several courses that are 100% online; international exchange students are limited to enrolling in up to 3 credits of online courses per semester.
Hybrid courses: ASU offers several courses that have both an in-person and online component. International exchange students are not restricted from taking hybrid classes.
Business Courses

Engineering: Engineering students cannot take any engineering capstone courses at ASU. In addition, some schools in engineering have further enrolment restrictions for engineering students.

Kinesiology, Department of: seats are limited depending on the specific academic unit or course

visa_info: All students are advised to apply for the necessary visa immediately after they receive the official offer letter/email from their host university. Some visa application processes can take up to 2 months to process.
accommodations_info: While international students can live where they would like, they are encouraged to live on campus in ASU residence halls. On-campus living provides more opportunities to make lasting friendships. On-campus housing is NOT guaranteed for exchange students, and is assigned on a first-come, first-served basis. Students should apply for on-campus housing immediately after they receive their official university acceptance for the best chance of receiving an on-campus assignment; however, being placed in university housing is never guaranteed. Students who are not successful in securing on-campus housing, or who do not want to live in the student dormitories, can search for off-campus housing in homestays or apartments. Most apartments require a contract between seven to twelve months, and are not furnished.
cost_of_living: International exchange students do not pay ASU tuition, but must pay student initiated fees that are mandatory for ASU students. Approximately USD $350 per semester. More information on fees can be found here. Students should also budget for additional costs such as mandatory health insurance (see above), special course fees, books and supplies, housing, meals, local transportation, and personal expenses.

visa_info: EU citizens and citizens from the following countries do not need a visa to enter Germany: Australia, Canada, Honduras, Iceland, Israel, Japan, Korea, Liechtenstein, Monaco, New Zealand, Norway, San Marino, Switzerland and the United States. However, after entering Germany, you will have to apply for a residence permit at the local 'Auslaenderbehörde' (Immigration Office) if you are staying for more than three months. Students from all other countries must apply for a visa for study purposes via the German diplomatic representation in their home country. You must not under any circumstances travel to Germany on a tourist visa.
accommodations_info: The International Office will provide accommodation in a student dormitory to all University of Freiburg Global Exchange students upon application. Student dormitories with single apartments or single rooms in shared apartments are available. They are 5-15 minutes by tram or bus, 5-20 minutes by bicycle, 10-40 minutes on foot from the university, depending on dorm location. Meals are not included. Please note that rooms in the student dormitory are only rented for the whole semester (Summer semester: 1st April till 30th September).

visa_info: Exchange students must apply to New Zealand Immigration for a student visa and obtain the visa before entering New Zealand. Please note that it is NOT possible for exchange students to travel to New Zealand on a visitor's visa and apply for a student permit upon arrival in New Zealand, even if you are a citizen of a country with which New Zealand has a visa waiver agreement. It is imperative that all exchange students get their student visa BEFORE travelling to New Zealand, as you may be refused a student permit if you apply from within New Zealand. Students are advised to apply for the necessary visa immediately after they received the official offer letter/email from their host university. This is to ensure that you can obtain your visa in time before the start of your exchange term. Your exchange at the host university depends on the clearance by the immigration of the host country.
accommodations_info: Exchange students are required to purchase a compulsory medical and travel insurance when studying in New Zealand. accommodations_info: For approved December Finish applicants: Sheffield’s Accommodation and Commercial Services liaise with Global Opportunities and Exchanges to offer short term contracts (i.e. less than a semester) to December Finish students. module_restrictions: Inbound exchange students are restricted from taking courses in Medicine, Law, Nursing, and Dental Hygiene. Graduate exchange students who want to take graduate level UHM courses in Second Language Studies (SLS) should have a TOEFL score of 100+. Students who want to take Business courses should already have a good foundation in business at their home university and a solid command of the English language, as normally demonstrated by a TOEFL score of 80+ (550+) or IELTS 6.5+.
visa_info: All international students (in F-1 and J-1 status) are required to begin the mandatory online Visa Clearance provided by UHM International Student Services (ISS) (https://www.hawaii.edu/issmanoa/?page_id=2227).

university.on-campus_housing: During the fall semester, there is a limited amount of on-campus housing available to international exchange students. Students coming to UHM for just the fall semester or for the academic year may apply for on-campus housing online, but are encouraged to explore off-campus housing options. Undergraduates are given preference for on-campus housing. During the spring semester, on-campus housing is widely available. International exchange students coming to UHM for the spring semester or calendar year are welcome to apply for on-campus housing online, and have a high likelihood of being placed. Apply for On-Campus Housing – In order to apply for on-campus housing, you need a UH Number (found on your Acceptance letter). Students may apply for on-campus housing online at UHM Student Housing Services. There is a $25 application fee that should be paid with a credit card. Please be sure to use the “Non-Freshman” application form; do NOT use the “Freshman” application form. Please note that the housing contracts at UHM are for the entire academic year (two semesters). If you will only be studying at UHM for the Fall semester, that’s OK. We will inform Student Housing Services and later they will be able to release you from the second half of your contract.
off-campus_housing: Hawaii Student Suites – Several student-friendly properties, including “Beachwalk” apartments located one block from Waikiki Beach, and “Kalo Terrace” community dormitories located one block from the UHM campus.

Off-Campus Housing Referral Program  – This website lists several good options. The Off-Campus Housing Referral Program website includes much useful information, including links to temporary housing, hostels and other off-campus options. Applications and/or reservations would need to be sent/made as soon as possible to insure a space when you arrive. Prices vary as do application procedures.

East-West Center – Next to campus and has two housing facilities for students: Hale Manoa and Hale Kuahine. Both facilities are primarily reserved for graduate students formally affiliated with the East-West Center, but any students are welcome to apply. Space is limited, and priority will be given to students majoring in Asia-Pacific related studies.

Due to limited space in dormitories for exchange students, some students make their own arrangements to reside in off-campus accommodations such as shared houses or apartments. Housing application information will be sent together with acceptance notification.
