visa_info:
Upon receiving your DS-2019, you will need to apply for your J-1 visa at a U.S. consulate or embassy. We recommend you visit the website of the US Embassy/Consulate where you wish to apply for your visa, and follow the procedures for documentation, interview request, etc. In general, you will need to present: 

1.    A valid passport from your own government. 
2.    A “Certificate of Eligibility” for a temporary stay in the U.S. (Form DS-2019 by Rice University or another   sponsor). 
3.    Financial documents to prove you have the funds required for a least a year’s stay in the U.S. (as   indicated on the DS-2019).  
4.    Proof of payment of the SEVIS fee. All J-1 visa applicants need   to pay the one time SEVIS fee prior to   applying for a visa. Keep your receipt as proof of payment to present to the US Consulate, port of entry   officials when entering the U.S., OISS upon check-in, and for your records. For more information visit:   www.FMJfee.com. 
5.    Completed visa application forms – be sure to indicate your name as stated on your passport and your   DS-2019 documents to better ensure that your name on your visa stamp will be displayed properly.

accommodations_info.University Accommodation: CUT does not guarantee accommodation to exchange students. Co-educative student on-campus housing refers to double rooms with shared bathrooms (each bathroom is shared by four students) and shared kitchen. Students may check-in in our dormitories a few days before semester starts.

module_restrictions: Business, Economics and Management modules are excluded from the exchange between NUS and Vilnius
Limited courses are also available at the Lithuanian Academy of Music & Theatre and Vilnius Academy of Fine Arts.
visa_info: Non-degree students from non-EU countries must get national Type D Visa prior to arrival in Lithuania. Required documents: Completed application, Letter of Acceptance from Vilnius University, visa application processing fee (if applicable), proofs of sufficient means of support (at least €200 per month + €400 for the return journey), 1 photo (colour, 35 x 45mm), valid passport, health insurance valid in Schengen countries (minimum coverage of €30,000), and letter of mediation (will be sent via e-mail by Vilnius University together with the Letter of Acceptance; validity 1 month).
accommodations_info: Dormitories are situated in Saulėtekio, Olandų or Didlaukio Street which can be around 20 minutes bus ride from the main campus at Vilnius’ old town. Only twin or triple sharing rooms are available. A group of five to six students will share a common bathroom. Common kitchens will be shared by around 20 students. There will be no gender division based on room, floor or building. Students can request to share rooms with the same gender. There will be 24/7 security officer manning the reception area of every dormitory building. Online application for accommodation must be submitted at least one month before the scheduled arrival.
cost_of_living: Details can be found at http://www.vu.lt/en/studies/practical-information/56-studies/studies/2507

visa_info: All registered NUS students are covered under the university health insurance and the blanket travel insurance. In addition, students will be required to enrol in the compulsory health insurance policy or scheme at their SEP host university. The cost of quality medical care in the United States is very expensive. Without medical insurance the cost of treatment for an illness or an injury resulting from an accident can be devastating. Indeed, receiving treatment is difficult if you do not have health insurance. Medical insurance is mandatory for ALL students at Emory University.

The Deutsche Bahn railway also provides connections to other major German cities and nearby countries.

location_vegetarian: Vegetarian food options are readily available in Aachen, with many restaurants and cafes offering vegetarian dishes on their menus.

location_vegetarian: Vegetarian food options are available in Pretoria, particularly in areas with a high concentration of restaurants and cafes.

visa_info.consular/visa_regulation: UK Visa and Immigration updates their immigration policy regularly. It is the student’s responsibility to check on the requirements via their website before they leave for the exchange. Standard Visitor Visa for Semester Exchange If you are a Singapore citizen or a citizen of another country on the UK non-visa nationals list, and if your course of studies is less than 6 months, you will request entry to the UK as a Standard Visitor when you arrive. Singapore citizens do not normally need to meet with a Border Force agent, and will be able to enter the UK through E-gates. Student Visa for Full-Year Exchange You need a Student Visa for a full-year exchange in Birmingham.
visa_info.health_insurance: Students who are on exchange in UK for less than six months are not entitled to subsidised NHS treatment. Therefore, semester-based exchange students are encouraged to purchase additional insurance to cover medical costs, hospitalisation expenses and emergency evacuation costs which might be incurred while they are on exchange.

location_description: Vancouver is a coastal seaport city in western Canada, located within the Lower Mainland region of British Columbia. It is the largest city in British Columbia and the seventh-largest in Canada.
location_crime: Vancouver's crime rate is higher than the national average, but is still considered relatively safe for a city of its size. Some neighborhoods have higher crime rates than others, so it's a good idea to research the area before choosing where to live.
location_transportation: Vancouver has an extensive public transportation system including buses, trains, and ferries. The SkyTrain is a rapid transit system that serves the Metro Vancouver area and is a popular mode of transportation for commuters.
location_halal: There are several halal food options available in Vancouver.
location_vegetarian: Vancouver has a large vegetarian and vegan community, and there are many restaurants that cater to this dietary preference.

module_restrictions: Undergraduate classes are numbered 100-499. Students must meet prerequisites to enroll in a class.
visa_info: Exchange students are eligible to apply for a J-1 or F-1 Visa. Clarkson will guide you through obtaining your visa.
accommodations_info: Exchange students are guaranteed housing and required to live on campus. Students will be assigned apartment-style housing in either Woodstock Village, Riverside Apartments, or Townhouse Apartments.
cost_of_living: Exchange students do not pay tuition. Students pay for their living expenses (housing and food) as well as other entertainment types (travel, books, incidental, and health insurance) of expenses. A link for an estimated expense breakdown from the 2019-2020 semesters is provided.
university_description: Clarkson University is a private research university located in Potsdam, New York. It was founded in 1896 and offers over 50 programs in 4 schools: the School of Arts & Sciences, the School of Business, the Wallace H. Coulter School of Engineering, and the Institute for a Sustainable Environment.
university_address: 8 Clarkson Ave, Potsdam, NY 13699-5715, United States
location_cost_of_living: The cost of living in Potsdam, NY is lower than the national average.
location_weather: Potsdam, NY has a humid continental climate, with cold, snowy winters and warm, humid summers.
location_description: Potsdam, NY is a small town in the northern part of New York State. It is situated in the foothills of the Adirondack Mountains and is known for its scenic beauty and outdoor recreational activities.
location_crime: Potsdam, NY has a low crime rate.
location_transportation: Transportation options in Potsdam, NY include buses, taxis, and rental cars.
location_halal: Halal food options are available in Potsdam, NY.
location_vegetarian: Vegetarian food options are available in Potsdam, NY.

faculties_accepted: Engineering Sciences in Chemistry, Biotechnology and Health (CBH)
module_restrictions: Exchange students should read a total of 30 ECs per semester and not more, and should take the majority of their courses within one specific school at KTH, provided that they meet the prerequisites specified for each course.
visa_info: Students from non EU/EEA countries need to apply for a residence permit for studies before entering Sweden. A minimum CAP of 3.0 out of 5.0 with no grade below C is required and a comprehensive health insurance that covers the whole period of stay in Sweden if admitted for less than a year is also required.
accommodations_info: KTH has an Accommodation Office located in the Info Center at KTH Entré (Campus Valhallavägen). KTH Accommodation rents rooms for exchange students in student housing buildings (dormitories) and apartment houses. Rooms are located in central Stockholm as well as in the suburbs of the city. The housing contract always terminates on the 31st of July and cannot be prolonged after this date.
university_description: KTH Royal Institute of Technology is a public research university in Stockholm, Sweden. It is Sweden's largest technical university and one of the oldest and most prestigious institutions of higher education in Scandinavia.

faculties_accepted: Faculty of Mathematics and Physical Sciences
Faculty of Social and & Historical Sciences
module_restrictions: Postgraduate modules are not open to undergraduate exchange students. UCL did not accept students for AY 19/20 and they may remain the case for future AYs.
visa_info: UK Visa and Immigration updates their immigration policy regularly. It is the student’s responsibility to check on the requirements via their website before they leave for the exchange. Medical insurance is recommended.
accommodations_info: UCL guarantees accommodation to exchange students who have been accepted to study at UCL for a full academic year, provided that they submit their housing application form by the deadline set by the Student Residences Office. Students who study at UCL for less than a full academic year are not guaranteed university accommodation.
cost_of_living: Information on cost of living can be found at https://www.ucl.ac.uk/scholarships/how-much-does-it-cost-study-ucl
university_description: University College London (UCL) is a public research university located in London, United Kingdom. It is a top-ranked university in the UK, consistently ranked among the top 20 universities in the world. UCL has a diverse student body, with over 41,500 students from over 150 different countries.

faculties_accepted: FASS, FoS, FoE, SDE, SoC and USP
module_restrictions: Law, education, and medicine courses not available for exchange students. Some colleges and academic departments at Penn State restrict enrollment in specific courses.
visa_info: Students must apply for the J-1 visa. The Certificate of Non-Immigrant Eligibility for J status is the DS-2019. This is also a non-immigrant visa status. The rules for the J-1 are similar to the F-1. However, there are two important differences. Those in J-1 status may be subject to what is referred to as the "two-year home residency requirement" or subject to 212(e) of the Immigration and Nationality Act. The other difference is that dependents may apply for work permission.
accommodations_info: On-campus housing and meal plans are available for exchange students but are not guaranteed. Students can also find resources for accommodation off campus.
cost_of_living: Please refer to the following link https://cce.ais.psu.edu/tuition-calculator-ui/#!/ to estimate the cost of attending PSU. Kindly disregard tuition fees as these will be waived under the exchange agreement between NUS and PSU.

university_name: National Yang Ming Chiao Tung University
module_restrictions: Departments which offer courses to exchange students are listed in https://drive.google.com/file/d/122j-Fur8Ja4MsdoKv9ec07HeHGr2Qqbj/view. Medicine, Dentistry and Nursing courses are not open to NUS students.
visa_info: Students whose exchange period is one semester (or less than 180 days) will have to apply a Visitor Visa while students whose exchange period is more than 180 days will have to apply for a Resident Visa. Chinese, Hong Kong and Macau passport holders will need to apply for a Taiwan Entry Permit.

accommodations_info.description: NYCU has a number of residence halls for exchange students. Once accepted into a residence hall, students are able to stay for the period of their studies at NYCU. However, due to high demand for housing, on-campus accommodation is not guaranteed.

Off-campus housing is also an option that exchange students may choose. However, students who wish to live off-campus are responsible for securing their own housing. Residences located off-campus are owned and operated by private individuals or companies, and NYCU is unable to make any arrangements on behalf of the students. Safety and the availability of public transportation should be taken into consideration when evaluating possible off-campus accommodations. Common price for off-campus accommodation ranges from USD$170 to USD$400 per month.

university_description: The National Yang Ming Chiao Tung University (NYCU) is a comprehensive university with more than 1,400 faculty and researchers and over 17,000 students, consisting of a broad spectrum of colleges, including engineering, medicine, nursing, dentistry, life sciences, social sciences, and humanities. NYCU seeks to establish itself as Taiwan’s most innovative smart medical research by developing medical applications in terms of AI, telemedicine, medical robots, Internet of Things, wearable devices, and blockchain biomedical as Eco-system among other developments.

university_name: Cornell University - College of Agriculture & Life Sciences (CALS)
faculties_accepted: College of Agriculture and Life Sciences (CALS)
module_restrictions: Enrollment permission is often subject to class size limitations, the consent of instructors, and demonstrated academic qualifications in the form of prerequisites. Some courses require one or many prerequisites.
visa_info: All students are advised to apply for the necessary visa immediately after they receive the official offer letter/email from their host university.
accommodations_info: On-campus housing is not usually available for incoming exchange students. Exchange Housing Program and Off-Campus Housing are options.
cost_of_living: For more information on financial matters, please refer to the following link. Please keep in mind tuition fees are waived for exchange students. https://finaid.cornell.edu/cost-attend
university_description: Cornell University is a private Ivy League research university in Ithaca, NY, USA with a focus on agriculture, life sciences, and related fields.
university_address: Ithaca, New York, USA
location_cost_of_living: Ithaca, NY has a relatively high cost of living compared to other cities in the USA.
location_weather: Ithaca has a continental climate, meaning cold winters and warm summers.
location_description: Ithaca is a small, but vibrant city located in the Finger Lakes region of New York state. It is known for its natural beauty, parks, and gorges.
location_crime: Ithaca is generally seen as a safe city. However, like any city, it is important to take precautions.
location_transportation: There is a free bus service that runs in Ithaca, as well as taxi and ride-sharing services.
location_halal: Halal food options are available in Ithaca, but may be limited.
location_vegetarian: Vegetarian food options are available in Ithaca, and there are several vegetarian and vegan restaurants.

module_restrictions:
First year and second year undergraduate students are not accepted at U Tokyo due to the internal structure of the university.
Faculty of Pharmaceutical Sciences and Faculty of Medicine are not open to exchange students.
Graduate courses are generally not applicable for undergraduate students.
visa_info:
Upon acceptance, U Tokyo will apply for a Certificate of Eligibility on your behalf with the Japanese Ministry of Justice, and send it to you when issued. The certificate is required for you to apply for a study visa. 
Exchange students must obtain a “College Student” visa for the duration of their study in Japan.  Please visit the Japan Embassy website for the required supporting documents for your visa application. 
All students are advised to apply for the necessary visa immediately after they received the official offer letter/email from their host university. This is to ensure that you can obtain your visa in time before the start of your exchange term. Your exchange at the host university depends on the clearance by the immigration of the host country.
accommodations_info: Exchange students may apply for university housing arranged by U Tokyo which are located off-campus. University housing is not guaranteed due to limited capacity. U Tokyo will contact students about housing application procedures after their exchange applications have been approved.
university_description: The University of Tokyo is a national research university located in Tokyo, Japan. Established in 1877, it is the first of the imperial universities, and now one of Japan's National Seven Universities. The university has 10 faculties, 15 graduate schools, and employs over 2,500 faculty members and 33,000 students. The university is considered one of the most prestigious universities in Japan and in the world.

faculties_accepted: Geneva School of Economics and Management
School of Social Sciences (Sciences De la Société)
module_restrictions: Students must restrict their choice of courses to 2 faculties (+ Intensive French courses). Bachelor students cannot access master courses.
visa_info: Non-EU citizens may require a visa and must contact the nearest Swiss embassy 3 months before entering Switzerland. Some visas can take as long as 3 months. A valid health and accident insurance is obligatory to reside in Switzerland.
accommodations_info: Students can register online for university accommodation at the Cité Universitaire de Genève. Rooms are allocated on a first-come-first-served basis.
university_description: The University of Geneva is a public research university located in Geneva, Switzerland. It was founded in 1559 by John Calvin as a theological seminary and law school.
location_cost_of_living: Geneva is known as a very expensive city, with high costs for housing, food, and transportation.
location_weather: Geneva has a temperate climate with warm summers and cool winters. The warmest month is July and the coldest month is January. Geneva receives a moderate amount of precipitation throughout the year.
location_description: Geneva is a global city and a center for diplomacy, with the European headquarters of the United Nations and many international organizations located there. It is known for its beautiful scenery, museums, and cultural events.
location_transportation: Geneva has an extensive public transportation system including buses, trams, and trains. The public transportation system is efficient and reliable.
location_halal: There are many halal food options available in Geneva, including restaurants and grocery stores.
location_vegetarian: There are many vegetarian food options available in Geneva, including restaurants and grocery stores.

visa_info: Exchange students who study for one semester only (less than 6 months) are not required to apply for a study permit. However, depending on your country of citizenship, you may have to apply for an eTA OR a visitor visa. For more information on visa applications, please refer to https://www.cic.gc.ca/english/visit/visas.asp.
university_description: The University of Waterloo is a public research university located in Waterloo, Ontario, Canada. It is most famous for its cooperative education (co-op) programs, which allow students to integrate their education with applicable work experiences.
location_cost_of_living: Waterloo has a relatively low cost of living compared to other Canadian cities. The cost of living index is 51.89, which is 48% lower than in New York.
location_weather: Waterloo has a continental climate, with cold, snowy winters and warm summers. The average temperature in January is -7.6°C (18.4°F), while the average temperature in July is 20.6°C (69.1°F).
location_description: Waterloo is located in southern Ontario, approximately an hour's drive from Toronto. With a population of over 100,000, it is home to two universities and a thriving tech industry.
location_transportation: Waterloo has a well-developed public transportation system, run by Grand River Transit (GRT). The university is serviced by several GRT bus routes, which run frequently throughout the day. There are also several ride-sharing services available in the area.
location_halal: Waterloo has several halal food options, including restaurants and grocery stores.
location_vegetarian: Waterloo has several vegetarian food options, including restaurants and grocery stores.

module_restrictions: Ensure that you meet the pre-requisites for the courses you are applying for.
visa_info: International students require a Non-Immigrant Education Visa to study in Thailand. Applications should be made at the Royal Thai Embassy before departure to Thailand.
accommodations_info: Affordable housing is available both on and off campus including shared housing, private flats (condos) and boarding houses.
university_description: Mahidol University is an autonomous research institution based in Bangkok, Thailand. Its international college runs courses in English within the fields of engineering, environment and resources, information and communication studies, liberal arts, medical technology, nursing, physical therapy, social sciences and humanities, and veterinary sciences.
location_description: Bangkok is the capital and most populous city of Thailand. It is known for its vibrant street life, cultural landmarks, and renowned shopping centers.

faculties_accepted: College of Architecture and Urban Planning
module_restrictions: Modules offered by the Chinese-German Institute for Applied Sciences are not available to exchange students.
visa_info: Exchange students in China are required to apply for student visa (X2 visa for those intending to study in China for a period of no more than 180 days and X1 visa for those intending to study in China for a period of more than 180 days).  You will receive the admission letter and visa application form (JW202) once you are accepted by the host university for the student exchange programme.  Exchange students are required to apply for the student visa in person at the China Visa Application Service Centre in Singapore with the relevant documents before the start of the academic semester.
accommodations_info: There are four dormitory buildings for international students located in three campuses (Siping, Zhangwu, Jiading campuses). Basically two students share one room and the cost. Each room is equipped with a toilet, shower and air-conditioner.  Each floor has a public kitchen equipped with microwave oven and induction cooker. In addition, you can also use self-service laundry conveniently.  For exchange students nominated at the University-wide level, students will be guaranteed a twin-sharing room during the semester by Tongji University.  This arrangement is not guaranteed over semester breaks.  Please confirm with the service centre at the on-campus accommodation directly.
cost_of_living: ranging from S$5,000 to S$15,000 per semester, subject to the country and local conditions at the overseas Partner University during the period of exchange
university_description: Tongji University is a public research university located in Shanghai, China. The university is especially known for its engineering, architecture, and business programs.
university_address: 1239 Siping Rd, Yangpu Qu, Shanghai Shi, China, 200092
location_cost_of_living: The cost of living in Shanghai is generally higher than in other cities in China. However, it varies depending on the location, accommodation, and lifestyle. It is recommended to budget around RMB 7,000 to 10,000 per month.
location_weather: Shanghai has a humid subtropical climate with four distinct seasons. Summers are hot and humid, while winters can be cold but usually not freezing. Spring and autumn are generally mild and pleasant.
location_description: Shanghai is China's largest city and a global financial hub. It is known for its modern skyscrapers, vibrant nightlife, and rich history and culture.
location_crime: Shanghai is generally a safe city with low crime rates. However, like any major city, it is important to take precautions and be aware of your surroundings.
location_transportation: Shanghai has an extensive public transportation system that includes metros, buses, taxis, and bicycles. The metro is the most convenient and efficient way to get around the city.
location_halal: There are many halal food options available in Shanghai, especially in the many Muslim communities throughout the city.
location_vegetarian: Vegetarian food options are also widely available in Shanghai, with many vegetarian and vegan restaurants and options in most dining establishments.

module_restrictions: EMBA is not available to exchange students.

accommodations_info: On-campus accommodation is available to exchange students. (4-person room for undergraduate and 2-person room for graduate students)
university_description: National Tsing Hua University is a research university with a long and proud tradition. Since the re-establishment in Hsinchu in 1956, the university has been known for her excellent academic programmes as well as her spacious verdant campus. NTHU initially began in Taiwan with nuclear sciences studies, and gradually expanded to include general sciences and engineering; in the past twenty years, the social sciences and humanities, life sciences, information sciences, and management sciences were added.

module_restrictions: Students who wish to take master level classes must request permission prior to arrival.
visa_info: All students coming to study at Sciences Po for longer than 3 months who come from a non-EU member state must apply for a residence permit in order to reside in France. All students who wish to study in France must follow the Campus France procedure on Etudes en France online platform before applying for a visa.
accommodations_info: Sciences Po does not offer on-campus housing. Students are responsible to find accommodation on their own and are encouraged to start searching early. Private accommodation options are available, as well as a university service to help students find accommodation in France.
university_description: Sciences Po Paris is a public research institution founded in 1872 as a private school to provide a new approach to social science education. It has since become a leading institution in the social sciences in France and specializes in fields such as international relations, political science, and economics.
location_description: Paris is the capital city of France and is known for its architecture, art, and fashion.
